    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static OffsetParameters create()
        Creates a new OffsetParameters object.
        Returns:
        OffsetParameters

      • getBevelRatio

        public final double getBevelRatio()
        The bevelRatio is multiplied by the offset distance and the result determines how far a mitered offset intersection can be located before it is bevelled. When mitered is specified, the value set for bevelRatio is ignored and 10 is sed internally. If bevelled is specified 1.1 will be used if no value is set for bevelRatio. The bevelRatio is ignored when rounded is specified.
        Returns:
        double

      • setBevelRatio

        public final void setBevelRatio(double bevelRatio)
        set the bevel ratio parameter.
        Parameters:
        bevelRatio - - The bevelRatio is multiplied by the offset distance and the result determines how far a mitered offset intersection can be located before it is bevelled. When mitered is specified, the value set for bevelRatio is ignored and 10 is sed internally. If bevelled is specified 1.1 will be used if no value is set for bevelRatio. The bevelRatio is ignored when rounded is specified.

        public final void setGeometries(Geometry[] geometries)
        Set the geometries parameter.
        Parameters:
        geometries - - The array of geomtries to be offset.

      • getOffsetDistance

        public final float getOffsetDistance()
        Specifies the distance for constructing an offset based on the input geometries. If the offsetDistance parameter is positive the constructed offset will be on the right side of the curve. Left side offsets are constructed with negative values.
        Returns:
        float

      • setOffsetDistance

        public final void setOffsetDistance(float offsetDistance)
        Set the offset distance parameter.
        Parameters:
        offsetDistance - - Specifies the distance for constructing an offset based on the input geometries. If the offsetDistance parameter is positive the constructed offset will be on the right side of the curve. Left side offsets are constructed with negative values.
